name: Balsamic Watermelon Cucumber Salad
description: An EASY, healthy, and light salad with watermelon, cucumber, arugula, goat cheese, candied nuts, and drizzled with a homemade balsamic glaze!! A PERFECT summer salad for those days when it's too hot to cook!!

author.name: Averie Sunshine

recipeIngredient: 3 cups watermelon, seeded and cubed (I recommend seedless, firm watermelon)
1 large cucumber or English cucumber, peeled and cubed
1/3 cup goat cheese, crumbled or as desired
1/3 cup candied nuts, or as desired

recipeInstructions.name: To a high-sided medium/large kettle (use one bigger...
recipeInstructions.text: To a high-sided medium/large kettle (use one bigger than you think you need), add the vinegar, 1/2 cup sugar, and heat over medium to medium-high until mixture boils and can sustain a fast rolling boil.

recipeInstructions.name: Boil for about 15 to 20 minutes, or...
recipeInstructions.text: Boil for about 15 to 20 minutes, or until reduced by about 80% and has thickened and is syrupy; stir intermittently and keep an eye on it so it doesn't bubble over.

recipeInstructions.name: When the sauce looks like it's about halfway...
recipeInstructions.text: When the sauce looks like it's about halfway done, taste the sauce, and if it's too vinegary and bitter for you, add part of or all of the remaining sugar. I personally use almost 1 cup. Sauce will thicken up more as it cools.

recipeInstructions.name: To a medium bowl, add all the remaining...
recipeInstructions.text: To a medium bowl, add all the remaining ingredients, stir to combine, and drizzle as much of the balsamic reduction as desired.
